column1: Newnan is a city in Metro Atlanta and the county seat of Coweta County
column3: approximately 40 miles (64 km) southwest of Atlanta. The population was 33
column7: for a growth rate of 103.4% over that decade.

column1: Newnan was established as county seat of Coweta County (replacing the defunct town of Bullsboro) in 1828 and was named for North Carolinian General Daniel Newnan. It quickly became a prosperous magnet for lawyers
column4: and merchants. Much of Newnan's prosperity was due to its thriving cotton industry

column1: Newnan was largely untouched by the Civil War due to its status as a hospital city (for both Union and Confederate troops)
column2: and as a result still features much antebellum architecture. Celebrated architect Kennon Perry designed many of the town's 20th century homes. During the Atlanta Campaign
column3: Confederate cavalry defeated Union forces at the nearby Battle of Brown's Mill.
a notorious lynching occurred after an African-American man by the name of Sam Hose (born Tom Wilkes) was accused of killing his boss
column4: Alfred Cranford. Hose was abducted from police custody
column7: and burned alive just north of town by a lynch mob of approximately 2

column1: Newnan was also host to the trial in 1948 of wealthy landowner John Wallace
column2: the first white man in the South to be condemned to death by the testimony of African Americans
column3: two field hands who were made to help with burning the body of murdered white sharecropper Wilson Turner. These events were portrayed in the novel Murder in Coweta County. The film version starred Johnny Cash

column1: In 1968 Kmart opened a warehouse in Newnan which slowly established Newnan as a major hub for distribution in the area. Around this time
column2: the International Brotherhood of Teamsters attempted to unionize the warehouse
column3: but the attempt was defeated when the employees voted 329 to 201 in favor of remaining union-free.  In 2015 the distribution center closed with a loss of 164 jobs.

column1: The city is home to one of the few Georgia counties with a museum that focuses mainly on African American history. The Coweta County African American Heritage Museum and Research Center
column3: was opened in July 2003 in a donated mill village house once owned by Ruby Caswell. The museum sits on Farmer Street on an old
column4: unmarked slave cemetery. It has collected hundreds of family genealogical records by interviewing residents and going through the census records. The museum also houses the Coweta Census Indexes from 1870 to 1920.The first black library in the county was the Sara Fisher Brown Library. Built in the 1950s
column5: the library has since been converted into the Community Action For Improvement Center.The Farmer Street Cemetery is the largest slave cemetery in the South
column6: and may be the largest undisturbed one in the nation. It is within the city limits of Newnan.

column1: Newnan is located in the center of Coweta County at 33°22′35″N 84°47′19″W (33.376411
column2: -84.788648). U.S. Route 29 passes through the center of the city
column3: leading northeast 13 miles (21 km) to Palmetto and south 7 miles (11 km) to Moreland. Interstate 85 passes through the eastern side of the city
column6: and 47. I-85 leads northeast 40 miles (64 km) to downtown Atlanta and southwest 125 miles (201 km) to Montgomery
column7: Alabama. U.S. Route 27A leads northwest from the center of Newnan 22 miles (35 km) to Carrollton.

column1: The climate is moderate with an average temperature of 64.3 degrees Fahrenheit (45.8 degrees in the winter and 79.1 degrees in the summer). The annual rainfall is 51.84 inches.
Newnan–Coweta County Airport provides chartered air service and flight training.

Mercer University has a Regional Academic Center in Newnan. The center opened in 2010 and offers programs through the university's College of Continuing and Professional Studies.
The University of West Georgia has a campus located in Newnan
column2: near downtown. This campus currently has two undergraduate programs: Bachelor of Science in Nursing and Early Childhood Education.Newnan is also home to a campus of West Georgia Technical College.
